summary.para: The CMSG_CTRL_DECRYPT_PARA structure contains information used to decrypt an enveloped message for a key transport recipient. This structure is passed to if the dwCtrlType parameter is CMSG_CTRL_DECRYPT.
For information about how CryptoAPI supports Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (S/MIME) email interoperability, see the Remarks section of.

member.name: CMSG_CTRL_DECRYPT_PARA.cbSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of this structure.

member.name: CMSG_CTRL_DECRYPT_PARA.DUMMYUNIONNAME.hCryptProv
member.summary: Cryptographic service provider (CSP) handle. The CNG function is called to determine the union choice.

member.name: CMSG_CTRL_DECRYPT_PARA.DUMMYUNIONNAME.hNCryptKey
member.summary: A handle to the CNG Cryptographic service provider (CSP). The CNG function, , is called to determine the union choice. New encrypt algorithms are only supported in CNG functions. The CNG function, , will be called to convert the CryptoAPI hCryptProv choice where necessary. We recommend that applications pass, to the hNCryptKey member, the CNG CSP handle that is returned from the function.

summary.para: The private key to be used. This member is not used when the hNCryptKey member is used.
The following dwKeySpec values are defined for the default provider.

listheader.description: Keys used to encrypt and decrypt session keys.
Keys used to create and verify digital signatures.

summary.para: If dwKeySpec is zero, the default AT_KEYEXCHANGE is used.

member.name: CMSG_CTRL_DECRYPT_PARA.dwRecipientIndex
member.summary: Index of the recipient in the message associated with the hCryptProv private key.
